content:
ErrorFormatterPage Class

In this Article

Specifies a built-in page that can render exception and error information to mobile devices. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItem(false)]
[System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")]
public class ErrorFormatterPage : System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage

  • Control
  • TemplateControl
  • Page
  • System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage
  • ErrorFormatterPage

Remarks

This page is internal and used by the adaptive error handling mechanism to provide error messages that are formatted appropriately for the target device.

Constructors summary

ErrorFormatterPage()

Initializes a new instance of the ErrorFormatterPage class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Properties summary

ErrorInfo

Returns information about an exception. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Methods summary

InitContent()

Initializes the content of the error page, based on the error information retrieved. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
LoadPageStateFromPersistenceMedium()

Loads any saved view-state information to the MobilePage object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
OnInit(EventArgs)

Called after an object, such as a form or a page, is initialized. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.
SavePageStateToPersistenceMedium(Object)

Saves any view or control state information for the page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

Constructors

  • ErrorFormatterPage()

    Initializes a new instance of the ErrorFormatterPage class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    public ErrorFormatterPage ();

Properties

  • ErrorInfo

    Returns information about an exception. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected System.Web.Mobile.MobileErrorInfo ErrorInfo { get; }

    Property Value

    • MobileErrorInfo

      A MobileErrorInfo object containing information about the error.

    Remarks

    This property is used by the adaptive error handling mechanism which provides error messages appropriately formatted for specific target devices.

Methods

  • InitContent()

    Initializes the content of the error page, based on the error information retrieved. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected virtual void InitContent ();

    Remarks

    The base implementation creates the mobile controls necessary to render the error.

    This property is internal and used by the adaptive error handling mechanism.

  • LoadPageStateFromPersistenceMedium()

    Loads any saved view-state information to the MobilePage object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected override object LoadPageStateFromPersistenceMedium ();

    Returns

    • Object

      An object containing the saved view state. Internally, this is typically a StateBag or IDictionary object.

  • OnInit(EventArgs)

    Called after an object, such as a form or a page, is initialized. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected override void OnInit (EventArgs e);

    Parameters

    • e
      EventArgs

      An EventArgs object that contains the event data.

    Exceptions

    • Exception

      there is no exception stored in the HttpContext.

    Remarks

    This method overrides the OnInit method to customize the event data for the adapter.

  • SavePageStateToPersistenceMedium(Object)

    Saves any view or control state information for the page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

    protected override void SavePageStateToPersistenceMedium (object viewState);

    Parameters

    • viewState
      Object

      An object in which to store the view-state information.
